issues.description: The problem specification declares checkOrderReady() as returning void, but the solution implements it with a boolean return type. This signature mismatch can confuse students about the expected method signature and may cause tests expecting a void method to fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the method signature with the specification by changing checkOrderReady() in the solution (and any template stubs) to return void instead of boolean, or update the problem statement to require a boolean return if that value is needed.
